entertainment.headline: Rahul Bose faces fraud charges for forging Himachal domicile to be rugby body chief The controversy began in 2023 after Rahul Bose pledged to the royal family of Shimla that he would help establish and recognise a state-level rugby association. The plans did not materialise.

Selena Gomez joins Taylor Swift at Chief's Game to support Travis Kelce Pop icons Taylor Swift and Selena Gomez, seen supporting Travis Kelce at the Chiefs game, reaffirmed their friendship after Swift attended Gomez's wedding. This marked Swift's fifth game since her engagement, thrilling fans who captured blurred stadium photos of the supportive duo.

Rekha honoured at Red Sea film festival during international premiere of Umrao Jaan Rekha has been felicitated with the Red Sea Honouree Award, marking an important moment in her career. While receiving the award, she reflected on her silent approach to life and work, urging the audience to "live by example."

Balakrishna's Akhanda 2: Thaandavam reportedly gets a release date? Check details Nandamuri Balakrishna's Akhanda 2: Thaandavam was postponed from its December 5 slot after financial issues stalled the release. The team is now working toward a December 12 release.

Actor Bhagyashri Borse opens up on faith, fans praise her simplicity Actor Bhagyashri Borse reflected on her childhood relationship with faith, comparing her bond with God to that of a father, a candid moment that drew warm praise from fans.

Kate Winslet finds weight-loss drug use terrifying; slams botox, fillers Kate Winslet called the pervasive use of weight-loss drugs and injectables like Botox "terrifying," urging young women to accept natural ageing and questioning the aspirational beauty standards driven by social media.

Vijay Deverakonda also joined the list.

Pranit More on being shamed for looks, background on Bigg Boss 19: It was difficult Pranit More opens up about his emotional journey and challenges on Bigg Boss 19. He shares how bullying and friendships shaped his experience on the show.

Who is Sunaina Yella? Indian actor dating UAE influencer Khalid Al Ameri Tamil actor Sunainaa and UAE influencer Khalid Al Ameri have drawn fresh attention online after sharing new photos together, adding momentum to long-standing rumours about their relationship.

Ajith's playful "You want to be like me?" moment with young fan goes viral Tamil actor Ajith Kumar shared a warm moment with fans in Malaysia while preparing for the Asian Le Mans Series. In the video, the actor can be seen talking to the children and posing for pictures with them.

Who is Dileep, the Malayalam star acquitted in the 2017 actor assault case? Being acquitted in the 2017 actor assault case after eight-and-a-half years has trained pan-India focus on Malayalam actor Dileep, especially as the verdict could mark a turning point in his film career and public image.

Akshaye deserves Oscar for Dhurandhar: Farah recalls Tees Maar Khan gag On Monday, filmmaker Farah Khan commented on Akshaye Khanna's role in Dhurandhar. She humorously said that he 'deserves an Oscar'. The remark was in reference to their previous collaboration in 'Tees Maar Khan'.

Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor to star in 3 Idiots 2 after 15 years: Report Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor are reuniting for the sequel to the cult classic 3 Idiots. The project was prioritised after Rajkumar Hirani paused his Dadasaheb Phalke biopic.

Singer Kanika Kapoor grabbed on stage at Meghalaya fest, raises safety outrage A fan unexpectedly approached Kanika Kapoor during her Me'gong Festival performance in Meghalaya, grabbing her. The unfortunate act has led to questions about event security for performers.

Saira Banu on Dharmendra's birth anniversary: He shone differently Saira Banu shared heartfelt reflections on late actor Dharmendra's legacy and his close connection with Dilip Kumar. Her social media tribute came on the occasion of Dharmendra's birth anniversary.

general news.headline: Communalists behind Vande Mataram objection: Priyanka reads Nehru's letter, slams PMCiting the 1937 letter written by former Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru to Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose, Priyanka Gandhi said, "The so-called objection against the remaining stanzas of Vandra Mataram was manufactured by the communalists." She went on to say that PM Modi did not mention this part in his speech.

India shouldn't be in delusion...: Asim Munir in 1st address as tri-services chiefIn his first address after becoming Pakistan's inaugural Chief of Defence Forces (CDF), Field Marshal Asim Munir warned India once again, asserting that any future act of aggression would be met with an even more "swift, severe, and intense" response from Islamabad.

Another ticking bomb in Goa? Deadly Birch fire spotlights owner's other nightclubVisuals show that the club is still on the beach and that during high tide, waves hit the loft of the club. Activist Ravi Harmalkar described it as a ticking time bomb, warning that another tragedy could have occurred.

Six 6E ideas to keep IndiGo flying and profitableTo remain profitable, IndiGo went where no budget airline in India dared to go. But regular off days for pilots will chip into the airline's profits. Here are some bright ideas to make 6E stay profitable. Read till the end.

Both accused took IndiGo flight 6E 1073 to Phuket at 5:30 am on December 7, barely five hours after the deadly incident that claimed 25 lives.

Dravida and Aryavrat: Land, Lines, Layers, LegendsThe Aryavrat of Manu had the Vindhyas as its southern border. Ancient works repeatedly identify the same Vindhyas as Dravida's northern frontier. In literature and in land, the lines seem clear.

Who is Kazakh dancer Kristina, who says Indian god saved her from Goa fire?A clip of a dancer at a Goa nightclub where 26 people were killed in a fire tragedy has gone viral. Moments after the blaze, Kristina, the dancer from Kazakhstan, was about to enter the very room where the fire is believed to have started. Kristina later said that a teammate's warning, whom she described as an "Indian god", saved her life.

Punjab Congress suspends Navjot Kaur Sidhu after 'Rs 500 crore CM post' remarkA day after Congress leader Navjot Kaur Sidhu triggered a political row by claiming that the party takes "Rs 500 crore in a suitcase" from anyone aspiring to become Chief Minister, the state unit on Monday suspended her with immediate effect. The official letter has not stated any reason for the sudden move.

Was Vande Mataram broken up to appease Muslims? Here are the factsPM Narendra Modi said crucial verses of Vande Mataram were removed, and called it the "division and partition of the song" that fuelled India's Partition. The two stanzas of Vande Mataram that were originally written by Bankim Chandra Chatterjee were adopted by the Congress leadership. Six stanzas with references to Hindu deities were dropped. This is what historians say about adoption of the truncated version.

Fake doctors on call on Blinkit? Experts flag 30-second antibiotic prescriptionBlinkit's doctor-call service has raised several questions about accountability, mostly blurring the line between accessibility and safety. Doctors warn strongly against this practice as it only worsens India's antibiotic resistance crisis.

Not Delhi or Lucknow, this city ranks as the 5th Best Food City in the WorldTasteAtlas has revealed its annual Best Food 2026 list, and India has secured a place in almost every category featuring the world's top 100.

China wants revenge: Chinese virologist who linked Covid to Wuhan lab is scaredChinese virologist Li-Meng Yan, who fled to the US after claiming Covid-19 was developed in a Wuhan lab, says she fears Beijing is using her family to lure her back to China. Meanwhile, her husband, virologist Ranawaka Perera, who hasn't spoken to her since she fled, wants to speak to her once to confirm her safety, even as Yan remains in hiding.

Want faster promotions? Professionals swear by the 70-20-10 ruleThe 70-20-10 formula by Lombardo and Eichinger is a career development model that divides growth into 70% on-the-job experience, 20% mentorship and feedback, and 10% formal learning. Professionals use it to accelerate promotions and build real-world competence faster than traditional training.

Salah dropped from Liverpool's Champions League squad vs Inter after public outburst Mohamed Salah has been left out of Liverpool's squad for their Champions League match against Inter Milan following his public criticism of the club and manager Arne Slot. SMAT 2025: Sai Sudharsan back in T20 mode after poor Test form, hits 100 in Ahmedabad SMAT 2025: After a poor run of form in Test cricket, Sai Sudharsan found his mojo in the shorter format, slamming a hundred for Tamil Nadu in Ahmedabad.

SMAT: After KKR retention, Ajinkya Rahane makes strong statement with unbeaten 95 Ajinkya Rahane sent a strong reminder of his value to KKR with an unbeaten 95 that powered Mumbai to a nine-wicket win over Odisha and secured their top spot in Elite Group A of the Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy.

Mitchell Marsh giving up Test return hopes? Australia star makes big career decisionAustralia all-rounder Mitchell Marsh will retire from Sheffield Shield cricket at the end of the 2025–26 season, putting his future in Test cricket in serious doubt.

Gautam Gambhir advised to stop picking fights after jibe at Parth JindalAakash Chopra has urged Gautam Gambhir to moderate his tone following a fiery press conference after India's ODI series win against South Africa. The advice comes amid Gambhir's criticism of media and Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal.

1st T20I: Suryakumar Yadav continues to be captain cool at pressersIND vs SA, 1st T20I: Suryakumar Yadav once again lived up to his "captain cool" persona as he fielded questions with trademark composure on the eve of the first T20I against South Africa. Asked about India's unusual new approach at the toss and the team's recent streak of losses, Suryakumar dismissed any fuss around the method, saying he was more than happy to follow KL Rahul's lead for the series. "I'll do it with my left hand as well," he smiled.

Chess: R Praggnanandhaa qualifies for 2026 Candidates after winning FIDE CircuitIndia's chess prodigy has gone on to win the FIDE Circuit 2025 tournament, securing his position in the upcoming edition of the Candidates tournament, set to begin in 2026.

IND vs SA T20I series Live Streaming: Squads, schedule and all you need to knowIND vs SA: India and South Africa will kick off a five-match T20I series on December 9 in Cuttack, with the first match at Barabati Stadium and the final one in Ahmedabad on December 19.

Despite 2-1 triumph, India penalised in ODI series against South AfricaIND vs SA: India were fined for a slow over-rate in the second ODI in Raipur, but still showcased impressive batting and bowling to secure the series against South Africa.

Hardik Pandya's return unlocks new combinations, balance for India: Suryakumar YadavIND vs SA T20Is: With the five-match T20I series against South Africa set to begin, India's preparation for the 2026 T20 World Cup is informed by recent stability in team selection and the return of key all-rounder Hardik Pandya, as confirmed by captain Suryakumar Yadav.

Smriti Mandhana back in nets after saying wedding is off, brother shares photoSmriti Mandhana returned to training at what appears to be a private facility. The India cricketer's brother shared a photo of her practising, accompanied by a heart emoji, a day after her wedding was officially called off.

Ricky Ponting hits out at Jofra Archer for fiery Steve Smith exchange at GabbaAshes, Australia vs England Gabba Test: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting did not hold back as he publicly slammed Jofra Archer for trying to sledge Steve Smith in the closing stages of the second Ashes Test at the Gabba in Brisbane.

IND vs SA: Suryakumar Yadav keeps mum on Rinku Singh's snub ahead of 1st T20IIndia T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav chose not to comment on Rinku Singh's omission ahead of the South Africa series. Rinku has been dropped from the team ahead of the five-match series and is playing in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy for Uttar Pradesh.

Shubman Gill vs Sanju Samson as T20I opener? Surya explains big selection callIndia vs South Africa, Cuttack T20I: Captain Suryakumar Yadav justified India's decision to hand the opening spot to Shubman Gill in place of Sanju Samson. The skipper added that Samson remains in contention, alongside Jitesh Sharma, for the wicketkeeper-batter's role in the build-up to the T20 World Cup 2026.

Pakistan squad unlikely to see major changes before T20 World Cup: Salman AghaPakistan captain Salman Ali Agha has offered fresh insight into how his side is likely to shape their squad for next year's ICC T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka, suggesting that the core group that has featured over recent months will remain largely unchanged.

Salah is destroying his legacy, has thrown Liverpool under the bus: RooneyFormer Manchester United forward Wayne Rooney has questioned Mohamed Salah's explosive Liverpool rant, saying the Egyptian star has thrown the club under the bus and is destroying his Premier League legacy.

Watch: Sania Mirza turns coach for son Izhaan in adorable Tennis sessionFormer tennis star Sania Mirza was seen coaching her son Izhaan in a heartwarming tennis session. Sania's mother Nasima shared the training video with fans.

Dhoni is very unique, we should be proud that he was born in India: Murali VijayFormer India and Chennai Super Kings (CSK) opener Murali Vijay, who spent a significant part of his international and IPL career under MS Dhoni's leadership, believes Indians should feel "proud" that a player of Dhoni's calibre was born in this country.

Baroda's Amit Passi equals world record with hundred on T20 debutAmit Passi hit 114 runs off 55 balls in his T20 debut for Baroda in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy on Monday in Hyderabad. His innings matched the world record for highest individual score on T20 debut.

Virat Kohli begins new chapter, announces partnership with Agilitas after Puma exitVirat Kohli announced his partnership with Indian sportswear startup Agilitas Sports on Monday, December 8. Kohli has reportedly ended his long-term association with Puma to invest in Agilitas.

Not England, but India are trendsetters in T20I cricket now: Phil SaltPhilip Salt hails India as the new trendsetters in T20I cricket after their 2024 World Cup win. Their unbeaten streak and top ICC ranking signal a shift in global T20 dominance.

Shakib Al Hasan eyes swansong in Bangladesh as political, selection hurdles lingerFormer captain Shakib Al Hasan wants one last chance to play in Bangladesh colours. Now it is up to the selectors and authorities to decide if the country's biggest star gets a final goodbye.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
